title: Voltage across 3 capacitors as dielectric removed

content.question: Three capacitors are connected in series to an ideal voltage source and charged, as shown in Figure 1 above. The capacitors are identical except that capacitor X has air between its plates, whereas capacitors Y and Z each have a dielectric slab of dielectric constant Îº > 1 between their plates. If the dielectric slab is removed from capacitor Z, as shown in Figure 2, which of the following describes what will happen to the voltage across each capacitor?

choices.label: Voltage across Capacitor X Voltage across Capacitor Y Voltage across Capacitor Z Increases Increases Decreases
Voltage across Capacitor X Voltage across Capacitor Y Voltage across Capacitor Z Increases Decreases Decreases
Voltage across Capacitor X Voltage across Capacitor Y Voltage across Capacitor Z Increases Decreases Increases
Voltage across Capacitor X Voltage across Capacitor Y Voltage across Capacitor Z Decreases Increases Decreases
Voltage across Capacitor X Voltage across Capacitor Y Voltage across Capacitor Z Decreases Decreases Increases

content.answer: Voltage across Capacitor X Voltage across Capacitor Y Voltage across Capacitor Z Decreases Decreases Increases

skill.text: 3.B: Apply an appropriate law, definition, theoretical relationship, or model to make a claim.
